task.title: Adjusting Invoices
task.abstract: Invoices are adjusted to account for several reasons, including late fees, write-offs, and refunds. Adding adjustments to posted invoices create adjusting entries that are reflected in the customer's financial software. Multiple adjustments can be made to an Invoice. The "Is Adjustment" field must be checked on each Invoice Line record that is being adjusted. Invoice lines cannot be added to paid invoices.

step.cmd: Navigate to the invoice needing adjustment via the Invoices tab in the eBusiness app.
Check the checkbox(es) related to the line item(s) needing adjustment on the Invoice Lines related list. Click the Create Adjustment Line button.
step.stepresult: A new invoice line is created and marked Is Adjustment. Next, navigate to the newly created invoice line and define the attributes that will affect the adjustment transaction.

step.cmd: Enter a negative or a positive value in the Sales Price to show a decreasing or increasing adjustment to the invoice, respectively.
Define the GL Account that will be the opposing entry to the defined A/R Account.
Check the Is Posted checkbox to create the Adjusting Transaction and click Save.
step.info: Check the Deferred Revenue Adjustment checkbox to identify the adjustment as a deferred revenue adjustment prior to sving and posting; the resulting transaction will adjust all deferred revenue transactions. Any transactions dated prior to the Adjustment Date will have a date of the Adjustments Posted Date.

ul.li: The adjustment line is posted in the Invoice Lines related list.
Adjusting entries are generated for reporting purposes.
Adjustments field on the Invoice record populates with the sum of the value of the related invoice lines Total field.
